page.title: 07ST MARYS AND ALL SAINTS
page.content:
St Marys and All Saints is a delightful church with a large parish dating back to the time of the old {Domesday Book}where it is mentioned as PLEMSTOCHA.
The church tower was built in the {15th century}and holds six 18th century bells. St Mary's has many stained glass windows and an impressive Norman font.An enormous {pipe organ}thunders into every corner of the building. There are lots of old{graves}in the yard, the oldest dating back to 1761,though the registers date back as far as 1591.
A Roman Catholic church built as recently as 1961 actually has a ship's bell to call worshippers to church.As it serves the whole of the Plymstock area it certainly needs to ring loudly
